sources.title: **ThoughtWorks.** "Architecture as Code: The Next Evolution." Technology Radar, 2024.
sources.summary: ThoughtWorks outlines the strategic shift towards treating architecture as continuously evolving code with supporting practices and tooling.

sources.title: **Martin, R.** "Clean Architecture: A Craftsman's Guide to Software Structure." Prentice Hall, 2017.
sources.summary: Robert C. Martin presents architectural design principles that inform the Architecture as Code philosophy.

sources.title: **Brown, S.** "C4 Model Overview." https://c4model.com/
sources.summary: Simon Brown describes the C4 model for visualising software architecture in code-centric formats.

sources.title: **Atlassian.** "Documentation as Code: Treating Docs as a First-Class Citizen." Atlassian Developer, 2023.
sources.summary: Guidance from Atlassian on adopting documentation as code practices to improve collaboration and governance.

sources.title: **GitLab.** "Documentation as Code: Best Practices and Implementation." GitLab Documentation, 2024.
sources.summary: GitLab explains operational approaches for managing documentation in version control alongside code.

sources.title: **GitHub Docs.** "About protected branches." https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/configuring-branches-and-merges-in-your-repository/about-protected-branches
sources.summary: GitHub describes protected branch policies that underpin governance workflows for Architecture as Code.

sources.title: **Open Policy Agent.** "Policy as Code Overview." https://www.openpolicyagent.org/docs/latest/
sources.summary: OPA provides a flexible policy engine that enables governance logic to be expressed and tested as code.

sources.title: **HashiCorp.** "Terraform Security Best Practices." HashiCorp Learning Resources, 2023. https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cloud-docs/recommended-practices/security
sources.summary: HashiCorp highlights secure operations for Terraform, reinforcing security considerations in Architecture as Code pipelines.

sources.title: **Google Cloud.** "Store Terraform state in Cloud Storage." Google Cloud Documentation, 2024. https://cloud.google.com/docs/terraform/resource-management/store-terraform-state
sources.summary: Google Cloud explains best practice for storing Terraform state securely using Cloud Storage.

sources.title: **Microsoft Learn.** "Store Terraform state in Azure Storage." Microsoft Learn Documentation, 2024. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-gb/azure/developer/terraform/store-state-in-azure-storage
sources.summary: Microsoft details Azure Storage options for Terraform state, illustrating multi-cloud security patterns.

sources.title: **Pulumi.** "Testing Infrastructure as Code Programs." Pulumi Blog, 2024.
sources.summary: Pulumi describes practical testing techniques that ensure Infrastructure as Code changes remain verifiable.

sources.title: **AWS.** "AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK) Developer Guide." https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cdk/latest/guide/home.html
sources.summary: AWS introduces the CDK for defining infrastructure in familiar programming languages, supporting Architecture as Code delivery.

sources.title: **Cloud Native Computing Foundation.** "State of Cloud Native Development 2024." Cloud Native Computing Foundation, 2024.
sources.summary: CNCF analyses adoption trends in cloud-native tooling that underpin Architecture as Code ecosystems.

sources.title: **Gartner.** "Forecast Analysis: Public Cloud Services Worldwide." Gartner Research, 2024.
sources.summary: Gartner forecasts growth in public cloud services, providing financial context for Architecture as Code investments.

sources.title: **HashiCorp.** "State of Cloud Strategy Survey 2024." HashiCorp, 2024.
sources.summary: HashiCorp captures executive perspectives on cloud strategy maturity that inform organisational adoption plans.

sources.title: **Thoughtworks Technology Radar.** "Governance as Code." https://www.thoughtworks.com/radar/techniques/governance-as-code
sources.summary: Thoughtworks emphasises governance automation patterns that keep Architecture as Code programmes compliant.
